head.title: Articles Reflect Greed And a Lack of Values

hedline.hl1: Articles Reflect Greed And a Lack of Values

abstract.p: Susan Lamoreaux letter holds two May 24 cover stories about real estate saleswoman Iris Kalt and lure of Bronxville addresses reflect greed and lack of values (S)

block.p: As a resident of Westchester since 1940 I was saddened last Sunday at the choice of the two cover stories, titled ''The Dealmaker'' and ''The Lure of a Bronxville Address.''
Both had to do with greed and a perplexing value system that obviously is permeating our society. After all, this was Memorial Day weekend.
As a resident of Westchester since 1940 I was saddened last Sunday at the choice of the two cover stories, titled ''The Dealmaker'' and ''The Lure of a Bronxville Address.''
Both had to do with greed and a perplexing value system that obviously is permeating our society. After all, this was Memorial Day weekend.
Maybe Iris Kalt gets ''turned on'' by making a sale, or tearing down a home on a prime piece of land, but is that really something anyone cares about?
And if I lived in Yonkers and the address was not good enough for me, I would certainly move elsewhere. Do people really live and die by their addresses? I sure hope not.
What about the more important issues, such as education, race, religion, mental illness, crime, arts, environment, quality of life?
It seems to me that there could be some front page stories there -- and not what turns on one woman or sends people to their post offices because they don't have a Bronxville address.
